alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 30 at 2:21AM MST until January 30 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Dangerous wind chills of 25 below to 35 below zero. * WHERE...Converse and Niobrara counties including the cities of Douglas and Lusk. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Dangerously cold wind chills could lead to hypothermia and can cause frostbite on exposed skin in 10 minutes or less.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, including a knit hat and mittens. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and strong winds will create dangerously low wind chill values. This will result in frostbite and lead to hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County
